parameters.definition: Number of people required to shovel snow for a small truck
Capacity of snow that a small truck can carry
Number of people required to shovel snow for a large truck
Capacity of snow that a large truck can carry
Total number of people available for shoveling snow
Minimum number of small trucks required
Minimum number of large trucks required
Proportion of the number of small trucks to large trucks

description: A snow removal company removes snow from neighborhoods using small trucks and large trucks. A small truck requires \param{PeopleSmallTruck} people to shovel the snow and can carry \param{CapacitySmallTruck} units of snow. A large truck requires \param{PeopleLargeTruck} people to shovel the snow and can carry \param{CapacityLargeTruck} units of snow. The company has available \param{TotalPeople} people. In addition, because some neighborhoods don’t allow big trucks, at least \param{MinSmallTrucks} trucks must be small. There must be at least \param{MinLargeTrucks} large trucks as well, and the number of small trucks must be \param{TruckProportion} times the number of large trucks. How many of each truck should be used to maximize the total amount of snow that can be transported?
